sections.MISSION: Comanche Troop, 1/2CR qualifies soldiers on the Skydio and DJI SUAS platform from 02APR-04APR24 and 08APR-10APR24 from 0900-1500 in order to increase SUAS operator flexibility and set conditions for Troop CALFEX.
sections.PURPOSE: This training will allow Comanche Troop to operate Skydio and DJI quadcopter systems. This will significantly enhance their reconnaissance, sensing, and targeting capabilities.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Red Line Brief
Emergency Procedures and Recovery
Understand integration of Intelligence Collection, Fires, and Maneuver
Understand communication architecture with SUAS and combined arms maneuver
Endstate
C/1/2CR integrates SUAS operations into future training.
Aircraft to be flown
DJI Mavic
Skydio X2

sections.END STATE:
3-4 operators per platoon and platoon forward observers can proficiently and safely employ the Skydio and DJI platform in daytime and outdoor conditions.
Training Objectives
Employ Skydio X2D and DJI MAVIC
Operate Skdio X2D and DJI MAVIC hand controller
Understand Military/Federal Airspace Guidelines and Policies
Demonstrate system knowledge and proficiency
Operate the Skydio X2D and DJI MAVIC ISO specific operational requirements

draw.mission_task_and_description: DJI Mavic/Skydio X2D Individual Qualification Training for C/1/2CRDates: 02-04APR24, 08-10APR24/ Location: VAAF Dates: 20-21MAR24 / Location: Range 206

values: Monitor local weather for possible extremes in cold, thunderstorm activity, high winds, etc Avoid
working in open areas when lightning is observed.
Address proper clothing requirements during extreme cold and wet conditions.
OIC and RSO will consistently monitor the weather. One alibi day has been built into schedule to allow for make up flight training if weather cancels outdoor training.
OIC - 1LT Marashlian RSO -SFC Gomez

subtasks.hazard: SLIPS, TRIPS, FALLS, MUSCULOSKELETAL INJURIES, & OTHER MISC INJURIES

values: Soldiers wear all assigned PPE, care is taken in unknown areas with rough terrain during execution. Additional caution will be taken when executing under limited visibility. Leaders maintain close control of Soldiers to identify potential hazards.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, Rehearsals, Dragoon Standard Uniform when operating military vehicles.
OIC, RSO, and Training team.
Soldiers will wear proper PPE and exercise caution when working with Stryker variants. Helmets always worn on vehicle and maintain three points of contact.
Briefing, Training, PCC/PCIs
OIC, RSO, and VCs
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period. All issued sensitive items tied down. Sensitive items inventory complete at conclusion of training.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, PCC/PCI
OIC, RSO, and training team.
Leave wildlife alone. Identify soldiers who are allergic to insect bites or stings and keep emergency first aid kits on hand.
Safety Brief
OIC, RSO, and Training Team

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO AND FROM TRAINING AREA

subtasks.hazard: COLLISIONS WITH MILITARY OR CIVILIAN MOTOR VEHICLES

values: Vehicles obey posted speed limits, following distances, and general awareness of civilian and other military traffic. Vehicles will have communication between each VIC prior to SP.
Convoy Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
OIC, RSO, and Training Team

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO AND FROM TRAINING AREA

values: Soldiers will be given an in-depth safety briefing concerning road safety. Convoy Commander and Leaders will monitor Soldiers and convoy operations. Proper rest plan in place.
Convoy Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
OIC, RSO, and Training Team
Soldier's briefed on potential hazards based on range reconnaissance.
Soldier's briefed on potential hazards based on range reconnaissance.
OIC, RSO, and CLS PAX

subtasks.hazard: DJI Mavic (UAS) COLLISION DURING LAUNCH, FLIGHT, OR LANDING

values: Prior to deploying or recovering any UAS, the UAS operators will inspect the area and ensure that a clear takeoff and landing lane is available
The UAS operators will communicate with personnel on the ground to ensure that the area is clear and that no unauthorized personnel are present in the launch or landing area.
The UAS operators will follow proper launch and landing procedures and utilize appropriate safety measures to prevent collisions and other hazards during UAS operators.
All UAS operators will receive training on proper UAS operations and safety procedures prior to conducting any UAS operations.
All UAS operations will be conducted in accordance with applicable regulations and guidelines to ensure safe and effective operations.
Master UAS trainer will be within arms reach of the trainee during take-off, flight, and landing operations.
Safety Brief and alert training team
OIC, RSO, and Training Team
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period IAW WE SOP.
Sensitive items will be accounted for after every mission/iteration
All issued sensitive items tied down IAW Troop SOP.
Sensitive items inventory conducted IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
Mission Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/PCI
Training Team
If communication with Range Operations is lost, the OIC/RSO will notify troop command
Cell Phone will be used to regain communication with Range Operations
Safety/Range Brief, check in with Range Control before and after each flight iteration.
RSO
Ensure SUAS Master Trainer is co-located within arms reach of SUAS Trainee IOT provide instruction on equipment and immediate intervention for safety concerns.
SUAS Master Trainer will be with every SUAS trainee during platform operation.
Training Team

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall risk to be low with the implemented control measures. Most Dangerous Risk: Cold Weather InjuryMitigation: Supervisors continuously monitor Soldiers for cold weather injuries and water. Soldiers given safety brief on weather. Vehicle warming area if needed.Most Likely Risk: Equipment LossMitigation: Ensuring proper PCCs/PCIs take place before, during, and after launch. A weather assessment will be conducted by both the OIC and RSO to mitigate flying in high winds. The UAS operator will continually communicate the location of aircraft to personal on-ground and avoid flying during limited visibility. Trainees will have a SUAS Master Trainer within arms reach and supervising during all portions of flight operation.
